faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The lecture course presents an overview of the properties of inorganic substances.  Much attention is paid to the relationships between the properties of substances and their structure and character of chemical bonding.  The topics covered by the lecture are examined and explained by solving exercises and problems in seminars.
description.et: Loengukursuses antakse ülevaade anorgaaniliste ainete omadustest. Suurt tähelepanu pööratakse ainete omaduste seostamisele keemilise sideme iseloomu ja ainete struktuuriga. Loengumaterjali selgitatakse ja kinnistatakse vastavate probleem- ja arvutusülesannete lahendamisega seminarides.

objectives.en: To give an introduction to modern inorganic chemistry by providing a foundation of physical principles and theory followed by descriptive chemistry of the elements
objectives.et: Sissejuhatus anorgaanilise keemiasse lähtudes füüsika põhimõttetest ja teooriast ning jätkates elementide keemiaga.

learning_outcomes.en: 1. knows the main classes of inorganic substances
learning_outcomes.et: 1. tunneb ja eristab anorgaaniliste ainete põhiklasse

learning_outcomes.en: 2. is able to apply the principles of the structure of substances for the characterising of the properties of substances;
learning_outcomes.et: 2. oskab rakendada aine ehituse põhiseisukohti anorgaaniliste ainete omaduste iseloomustamisel, seostada ainete omadusi keemilise sideme tüübi ning aine struktuuriga

learning_outcomes.en: 3. knows the equilibria of acid base and redox processes and has the skills in problem solving
learning_outcomes.et: 3. orienteerub happe aluse tasakaalude ja redoksprotsesside põhimõistete valdkonnas, oskab neid teadmisi kasutada anorgaaniliste ainetega kulgevate keemiliste reaktsioonide kirjeldamisel

learning_outcomes.en: 4. knows the typical reactions of inorganic substances and is able to characterise them
learning_outcomes.et: 4. teab ja oskab kirjutada anorgaaniliste aineklassidele iseloomulike tüüpreaktsioonide võrrandeid

learning_outcomes.en: 5. knows the main applications of inorganic substances in practice and is able to connect them with the properties of substances
learning_outcomes.et: 5. tunneb anorgaaniliste ainete tähtsamaid praktilise rakenduse valdkondi, oskab rakendusvaldkondi seostada vastavate ainete omadustega

independent_work.et: Mandatory independent assignments in form of the homework are required to pass the subject. Homework is a weekly individual assignment or group assignment that must be submitted on time and accomplished at a given level.

description.et: Mandatory independent assignments in the form of homework are required to pass the subject. Homework is a weekly individual or group assignment that must be submitted on time and accomplished at a given level.

1st Test on the 1-3 week topics
To pass the test, one must get at least 51%

2nd Test on the 5-8 week topics
To pass the test, one must get at least 51%

grade_preconditions.et:
1. The result of each test must exceed the 51% limit. 
2. Homework must be submitted on time and accomplished at a given level.

grade_evaluation.et:
The 1st Test gives 25 points for the final grade
The 2nd Test gives 25 points for the final grade
Homework gives 20 points for the final grade

The test can be performed during the spring semester. You are admitted to the exam if both of the (1st and 2nd) tests have been completed to 51%.

30 points of the final grade are given by a written exam assignment, which takes place at the end of the semester during the exam session. The exam assignment includes theoretical questions and calculation problems. The examination assignment is considered to be passed positively if it scores at least 51%.

Final grade:

25 points 1st Test + 25 points 2nd Test  + 20 points homework + 30 points exam assignment = 100 points (A)

91-100 points A
81-90 points B
71-80 points C
61-70 points D
51-60 points E

debt_elimination.et: Each of the two tests can be retaken once during the semester.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials: J. Keeler and P. Wothers, Chemical Structure and Reactivity
resources.recommended_materials: P.W. Atkins and  L. Jones, Chemical Principles

description.et:
Week 1  (lecture +seminar)
Introduction: atoms, electrons, molecules, and molecular structures

Week 4
Recapitulation before the 1st Test: weeks 1-3
1st Test

Week 9
Recapitulation before the 2nd Test: weeks 5-8
2nd Test
